children.name: Requirement
children.comment: Software/Product Requirements

children.name: Market Research (Voice of Customers)
children.comment: Market research shows whats are the different products available and their market share. It also shows what exactly is the customer wants and need.

children.name: Competitive Analysis
children.comment: This shows different products and their offerings in the given domain.

children.name: MGPP
children.comment: From the Market research and Competitive analysis we prepare the Multi Generation product Plan, which shows what products features will be available on which milestone

children.name: Product Requirement Specifications
children.comment: Depending upon the product generation, product feature the product requirements specifications are created.

children.name: Persona
children.comment: This shows the different persona in the given domain along with their roles, responsibilities. The goals they are trying to achieve on daily, weekly, monthly and yearly basis

children.name: Context Scenaio
children.comment: This shows how a particular persona achive their goals.

children.name: WireFrame
children.comment: This shows the User interaction with the system, its screen flow, in achieving different goals.

children.name: Software Requirement Specifications
children.comment: This shows the software requirement.

children.name: Installation Requirements
children.comment: What are the different mode of installation available, CD, USB, Web, Cloud. How the installation are send to the user. Customer information that are acquired before sending or sharing the binaries

children.name: Upgrade Requirements
children.comment: How the customer are notified if the patch are available. What are different steps that need to be taken to upgrade the software from version vX to vY

children.name: Licensing Requirements
children.comment: This shows the different licensing requirement. It discuss about different licensing scheme, node-lock, user based etc. It also discuss about feature based licenses

children.name: Security Requirements
children.comment: Security Requirements.

children.name: Threat Modeling
children.comment: The system context diagram is used for modeling the threat to the system and the mitigation plan. These mitigation plan may add additional requierments

children.name: User Authentication
children.comment: How user is authenticated by the system. So user registration, password policies, different ways of authenticating a user

children.name: User Authorization
children.comment: Policy for authorization, role based, activity based, user based

children.name: User Account Management
children.comment: Manangement of the user account information, password policies, password storage etc.

children.name: Password Encryption
children.comment: How the password is stored on the disk, transmitted on the wire and authenticated

children.name: Non Functional CTQs
children.comment: Non function requirements on the system, this covers all the lities

children.name: System Test Cases
children.comment: Each scenarion may give rise to one or more system test cases.

children.name: Stories
children.comment: The procedure and steps to achieve goals are translated into stories

children.name: Acceptance Criteria
children.comment: Each story is given acceptance criteria. The criteria to accept the story and mark it as complete

children.name: Safer
children.comment: The Safer requirement

children.name: TRS Document
children.comment: The Teachnical Requirement Specification requirement

children.name: Design
children.comment: Design of the software systems

children.name: Applicable Design Practices
children.comment: It helps in recognizing and reusing the applicable design practices

children.name: Quality Attributes
children.comment: Quality attributes define attributes that affects the overall system design, runtime, design time and user centric issues

children.name: Architectural Principles
children.comment: Architectural principles relates the business objectives and key architecture drivers

children.name: Business Domain Model
children.comment: Domain objects and their relation in a particular business domain, validation and states.

children.name: Subsystem Design
children.comment: Diagram showing different subsystems, theirs roles and responsibilities

children.name: API Design
children.comment: Diagram showing different api that is used to access, change the state of the domain objects

children.name: Database Design
children.comment: Design showing different tables and their relationship in storing the domain objects persistently in the database.

children.name: Class Diagram
children.comment: Subsystems are broken in different classes that handle a particular responsibility in meeting the user goal scenario

children.name: Component and Connector Diagram
children.comment: It represents different components, their interface and interactions with the other components.

children.name: System Context Diagram
children.comment: The diagram shows the boundaries between the systems and its environment. Interaction of different entities in the system

children.name: Deployment Diagram
children.comment: Deployment of different software artifacts in the enterprise

children.name: Technology Accessment
children.comment: Depending upon the problem in hand, evaluation different technologies based on the options provided for each properties

children.name: Risk Assement & Planning
children.comment: Document showing the risks, severity and probability and its mitigation plan along with follow up actions

children.name: Time/Budget Constraint applicable on the product
Commercial Constraints applicable on the product
Technology Constraints
children.comment: Technology considerations applicable on the product

children.name: Deployment Constraints
children.comment: Constraint on the deployment of the product

children.name: Opportunities
children.comment: The opportunies available or coming forth to this product

children.name: Quality Plan
children.comment: Document specifying quality standards, practices, resources, specifications and sequence of activities of project

children.name: Tools
children.comment: Tools applicable on this project

children.name: Development Machines
children.comment: Define the configuration and quantity of development machines

children.name: Test Machines
children.comment: Define the configuration and quantity of test machines

children.name: Compiler
children.comment: Different tools that are used to create the binaries, executable deployments

children.name: IDE - Interactive Development Environment
children.comment: Different tools that are used to create the code for the software application

children.name: Component or Libraries
children.comment: Define the additional libraries or component that will be used, find its licensing requirement, acquisition procedure

children.name: Unit Testing Tools
children.comment: Define the testing tools required, number, quantity, licensing requirement and acquisition procedure

children.name: Component Testing Tools
children.comment: Define the testing tools required, number, quantity, licensing requirement and acquisition procedure

children.name: Integration Testing Tools
children.comment: Define the testing tools required, number, quantity, licensing requirement and acquisition procedure

children.name: Performance Testing Tools
children.comment: Define the testing tools required, number, quantity, licensing requirement and acquisition procedure

children.name: Reliability Testing Tools
children.comment: Define the integration testing tools required, number, quantity, licensing requirement and acquisition procedure

children.name: Code Coverage Tools
children.comment: Define the code coverage tools required for different languages, number, quantity, licensing requirement and acquisition procedure

children.name: Database
children.comment: Define the database required, quantity, licensing requirement and acquisition

children.name: Process
children.comment: The process that will be adopted in development of this product

children.name: Agile Development Process
children.comment: Document describing the agile development process, with details steps

children.name: Backlog Management
children.comment: Select the tools that will be used for backlog management, configuration and use of that tool

children.name: Team
children.comment: Create a team with their roles and responsibilities.

children.name: Stake Holders
children.comment: Analyze different stake holders, their roles and responsibilities.

children.name: Backlog Creation
children.comment: Create a prioritize backlog of each items from the stories defined above.

children.name: Estimation
children.comment: Estimate each stories, if there are unknown then give 13 pointer to the story and define a spike before it. Spike should be taken before the story in a sprint.

children.name: Budgeting
children.comment: Define the budget requirement

children.name: Resource Planning
children.comment: Define the teams, roles and responsibilities of each team members

children.name: Scrum
children.comment: Define the scrum cycle, scrum master, retrospection and escalation plans etc

children.name: Release Planning
children.comment: Plan the complete release based on the prioritized stores

children.name: Working Agreement
children.comment: Define the working agreement of the team with the stake holder.

children.name: Stop the line Criteria
children.comment: Define when to raise stop the line and who will raise it

children.name: CTH Approvals
children.comment: Define what'll are required for CTH approval

children.name: NCA and RCA
children.comment: Define the NCA and RCA process and when to activate it.

children.name: Communication Plan
children.comment: Define the communication plan

children.name: Ready-Ready Expectations
children.comment: Define the ready-ready expectation for each story

children.name: Done-Done Expectations
children.comment: Define the done-done criteria for each story

children.name: Sprint Planning
children.comment: Define the sprint planning process

children.name: Retrospection
children.comment: Define and capture various restrospection from the team. How it is communicated and use.

children.name: Demo
children.comment: Define how the demo will be done.

children.name: Agile Management Tool
children.comment: Define the agile management tools that will be use by the team, licensing, cost and other managemet aspects

children.name: Configuration Management
children.comment: Define the configuraiton management tools that will be use by the team, licensing, cost and other management aspects

children.name: Source Control Server Setup
children.comment: Define the server requirement for control the project source code.

children.name: Production Source
children.comment: Define how production source will be organized. Who willl have what kind of permissions

children.name: Unit Test Source
children.comment: Define how unit test source will be organized. Who will have what kind of permissions.

children.name: Component Test Source
children.comment: Define how component test source will be organized. Who will have what kind of permissions.

children.name: Integration Test Source
children.comment: Define how integration test source will be organized. Who will have what kind of permissions.

children.name: Performance Test Source
children.comment: Define how unit test source will be organized. Who will have what kind of permissions.

children.name: Reliability Test Source
children.comment: Define how unit test source will be organized. Who will have what kind of permissions.

children.name: Setting Up Build Machine
children.comment: Document showing the steps required to setup the build machine

children.name: Setting up Slave Machines
children.comment: Document showing the steps required to setup the slave machine

children.name: Smoke Test
children.comment: Steps required for setting up, running the smoke test, procedure and dashboard requirements

children.name: Component Tests
children.comment: Steps required for setting up, running the component test, procedure and dashboard requirements

children.name: Regression Tests
children.comment: Steps required for setting up, running the regression test, procedure and dashboard requirements

children.name: Static Analysis
children.comment: Steps required for setting up, running the static analysis, procedure and dashboard requirements

children.name: Code Coverage
children.comment: Steps required for setting up, running the code coverage, procedure and dashboard requirements

children.name: Backward Compatibility Strategy
children.comment: Document describing how the new product allow for interoperability with an older system

children.name: Exception Handling Strategy
children.comment: Document describing how the new product handle, log and propagate exception occuring inside the system

children.name: Logging Strategy
children.comment: Document what information are logged and how it is stored in the system so that logs are effective to diagnose coding errors

children.name: Globalization Strategy
children.comment: Document depending upon the technologies what care has to be taken in order to make the system globalized.

children.name: Localization Strategy
children.comment: Document the procedure to support other non-english languages

children.name: Licensing Strategy
children.comment: Document the procedure for supporting different licensing requirements

children.name: Modularity Strategy
children.comment: Set of standards, rules and guidelines for all contributors to follow

children.name: Versioning Strategy
children.comment: Document the rule how version number are assigned, incremented and used

children.name: Backup and Restore Strategy
children.comment: Document mentioning various options of backing up system based on the time and space, and restoring it back

children.name: Upgrade Strategy
children.comment: Document mentioning the various components that will be upgraded in case of system upgrade. How they will be upgraded and what care needs to be taken if upgrade fails.

children.name: Test Strategy
children.comment: Document mentioning about the various testing that will be done on the system with the reasons, the resource requirements etc

children.name: Crash Dump Strategy
children.comment: Documenting showing what needs to be done in case of crash reported on various systems

children.name: Customer Reported Defect Strategy
children.comment: Documenting mentioning what information needs to be collected if Defect is resported on the field on customer site that will help the development team to reproduce the defects quickly

children.name: Best Practices
children.comment: The best practices that needs to be followed in software development

children.name: UX Best Practices
children.comment: Best Practices to build the fluid user experiences

children.name: Node Best Practices
children.comment: Best Practices to build the Node js applications

children.name: angular Best Practices
children.comment: Best Practices to build the angular js front end applications

children.name: MemoryValidator
children.comment: Memory Validator checks the memory leaks, resource and handle leak in C++ application
